is that there's an initial

And then, the k-means algorithm

within cluster sum of squares.

That is to make it as small
as possible by swapping
points between clusters.

So the other type of clustering

And remember, one of the main
difference between k-means

and hierarchical clustering
is in hierarchical clustering,

we start with small
clusters and build them up
as we go along the path.

Whereas k-means
just directly tries

to break into a fixed
number of clusters.

So in hierarchical
clustering, one

of the biggest choices
you have to make
is the so-called linkage.

And remember, that's
the rule that's

used that decides how
clusters are merged.

The three main linkages are
complete, single, and average.

of thumb-- complete

just often has nicer
